intro: Glochidion subsessile var. birmanicum, commonly known as the Burmese glochidion, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in regions of Myanmar and Thailand. The plant is a small shrub characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an important component of the understory vegetation in tropical rainforests.
